page.title: 12Cubs and Scouts in Colwall
page.content: The{1st Colwall Scout Group}meets in a building situated behind the Church Rooms, originally built during World War II for cooking meals served there and taken to farms for workers. Later the County Council cooked meals which were taken to 1 Grammar, 2 Infant and 2 Junior Schools. In 1982 the Scouts purchased the building and converted it to their Headquarters in 75 days to celebrate 75 years of Scouting. Boys from all types of homes are members: 14 cubs (8-11) meet on Mondays; 15 Scouts (11-16) and 8 Ventures (16+) meet on Fridays. There are 8 adult leaders. Activities are designed to stretch boys mentally and physically. Wherever possible activities are connected with outdoor pursuits (i.e. Camping). In 1985 the Scouts are camping in Holland - carrying everything on their bicycles.
